meanings.definition: A person who freely offers to take part in an enterprise or undertake a task.
meanings.sent1: The school event was successful thanks to the hardworking volunteer.
meanings.sent2: She decided to become a volunteer at the local animal shelter.
meanings.sent3: The volunteer joked that she was the 'chief cookie tester' at the bake sale.
meanings.sent4: Being a volunteer is like being a superhero without a cape.
meanings.sent5: The image of the volunteer helping the elderly will always stay with me.

meanings.definition: To offer to do something without being forced to do it.
meanings.sent1: I volunteer to help clean up the park every weekend.
meanings.sent2: He volunteered to lead the team in the upcoming project.
meanings.sent3: She decided to volunteer to be the taste tester for the new ice cream flavors.
meanings.sent4: Volunteering to be the first to try the new ride was exhilarating.
meanings.sent5: The team captain asked for someone to volunteer to be the spokesperson.

meanings.definition: Done, given, or acting of one's own free will.
meanings.sent1: Her volunteer work at the hospital was deeply appreciated.
meanings.sent2: The volunteer firefighter rushed into the burning building to save the cat.
meanings.sent3: The volunteer chef surprised everyone with a delicious meal.
meanings.sent4: His decision to help without being asked showed his volunteer spirit.
meanings.sent5: The volunteer gardener transformed the community park into a beautiful oasis.
